pageContext.claim: “I was with Prime Minister Abe the other day, and he said -- we spoke the other day. And he said that Japan is going to be sending about seven -- at least seven more big factories into this country. And it’s got to do more than that; we have too big a deficit with Japan.”
pageContext.analysis: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has claimed that Japanese companies are investing $20 billion to create 37,000 jobs in the United States over the next 10 years. He gave Trump a chart that listed seven companies, for a total of 14,300 jobs, but these are not all new factories.
